===Alternative forms===
* {{ja-l|紫菀}} {{qualifier|less common}}

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|し|おん|yomi=on}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=しおん}} {{m|ltc|紫菀}}. Compare modern {{cog|cmn|紫菀|tr=zǐwǎn}}.

====Pronunciation====
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|音読み|On'yomi}}
* {{ja-accent-common|a|し|おん}}<ref name="NHK">{{R:NHK Hatsuon}}</ref>
* {{ja-accent-common|h|し|おん}}<ref name="NHK"/>
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[ɕiõ̞ɴ]}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|しおん|hhira=しをん}}

# an [[aster]], a [[Michaelmas daisy]]: {{taxlink|Aster tataricus|species|noshow=1}}

====Proper noun====
{{ja-pos|proper|しおん|hhira=しをん}}

# {{given name|female|lang=ja|sort=しおん}}

=====Derived terms=====
* {{ja-l|紫苑色|しおんいろ|shion iro}}: a specific [[color]] [[coordination]] when wearing layered [[robe]]s, usually with [[violet]] (the color of the [[aster]]) as one of the layers

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|し|おに|yomi=irreg}}
Alteration from ''shion'', where the final moraic ''n'' changed to ''ni''.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

{{IPAchar|/ɕion/}} → {{IPAchar|/ɕioni/}}

====Pronunciation====
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|音読み|On'yomi}}, irregular
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[ɕio̞ni]}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|しおに|hhira=しをに}}

# an [[aster]], a [[Michaelmas daisy]]: {{taxlink|Aster tataricus|species|noshow=1}}

====Proper noun====
{{ja-pos|proper|しおに|hhira=しをに}}

# {{given name|female|lang=ja|sort=しおに}}

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|し|えん|yomi=on}}
Alteration from ''shion'', using the [[漢音#Japanese|''kan'on'']] reading of ''en'' for the second character. Less common.

====Pronunciation====
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|音読み|On'yomi}}
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[ɕiẽ̞ɴ]}}

====Proper noun====
{{ja-pos|proper|しえん|hhira=しゑん}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=しえん|rare}} {{given name|female|lang=ja|sort=しえん}}
